content.question:
A particle moving along a curve in the xy-plane has position (x(t), y(t)), at time t > 0, where

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>6</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>/</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGKbGaamiEaaqaaiaadsgacaWG0baaaiabg2da9maabmaabaWaaSaa aeaacaaI2aaabaGaamiDaaaacqGHsislcaaIZaaacaGLOaGaayzkaa WaaWbaaSqabeaadaWcgaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaIZaaaaaaaaaa@418B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mi>t</mi> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGKbGaamyEaaqaaiaadsgacaWG0baaaiabg2da9iaadshacaWGLbWa aWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaWG0baaaaaa@3ECB@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

At time t = 3, the particle is at the point (5, 4).

(a) Find the speed of the particle at time t = 3.

frqParts.text:
A particle moving along a curve in the xy-plane has position (x(t), y(t)), at time t > 0, where

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>6</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>/</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGKbGaamiEaaqaaiaadsgacaWG0baaaiabg2da9maabmaabaWaaSaa aeaacaaI2aaabaGaamiDaaaacqGHsislcaaIZaaacaGLOaGaayzkaa WaaWbaaSqabeaadaWcgaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaIZaaaaaaaaaa@418B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mi>t</mi> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGKbGaamyEaaqaaiaadsgacaWG0baaaiabg2da9iaadshacaWGLbWa aWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaWG0baaaaaa@3ECB@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

At time t = 3, the particle is at the point (5, 4).

(a) Find the speed of the particle at time t = 3.
(b) Write an equation for the line tangent to the path of the particle at time t = 3.

(c) Is there a time t at which the particle is farthest to the right? If yes, explain why and give the value of t and the x-coordinate of the position of the particle at that time. If no, explain why not.
(d) Describe the behavior of the path of the particle as t increases without bound.

topic.text: 1.15: Connecting Limits at Infinity and Horizontal Asymptotes

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
